response_component: (will be added by processing script)
(will be added by processing script)

cohort: cohort - any characteristics of the population(s) studied, plus whether the result was taken from a subgroup of the broader cohort tested.
age_min: age_min - age of youngest subject including both cases and controls
age_max: age_max - age of oldest subject including both case and controls
number_subjects: number of subjects - count of case plus control subjects used in the measurement.
method: method - primary experimental method used to measure the response
response_component: response component
is_model: signature was derived from a computational model
comparison: comparison (affected vs control, correlated variable, time vs baseline event)
time_point: time relative to baseline event at which response was measured
exposure_material_id: exposure material id, e.g. NCBI taxonomy ID
exposure_process: exposure process - method by which immune exposure  occurred
disease_stage: disease stage - reported disease stage(s) of affected subjects
signature_source: signature source - figure, table or text section

tissue_type: As reported. Only one entry allowed.
tissue_type_term_id: Choose from list or lookup Cell Ontology code. Use format type:code e.g. CL:0000236, UBERON:0000178.
method: Choose from list.  Only one entry expected.  You can add new methods.
response_component: Gene or protein symbols can be separted with commas, spaces, or semicolons.  Cell types or other names must be separated using semicolons.
response_behavior_type: Choose from list. Only one entry allowed.
response_behavior: Choose from list.  Only one entry allowed.  Add new behaviors if required.
comparison: Free text. Use "vs" rather than a dash to separate comparison terms (A vs B).  Separate multiple comparison entries with semicolons (A vs B; C vs D).
baseline_time_event: Free text. Use "none" if no time was reported.
time_point: Number. Use "none" if no time was reported.
exposure_material_id: NCBI Taxonomy ID. Choose from list.
exposure_process: Choose from list.  Enter new process if needed.
publication_reference_url: The URL only, not any associated display text
signature_source: Free text. Up to two entries, separated by semicolons
signature_source_url: The URL only, not any associated display text. Up to two entries, separated by semicolons

cohort: Any characteristics of the population(s) studied, besides age.  Example:  Hong Kong, Atlanta  Also report if the result was limited to a subgroup of the tested cohort, e.g.  - subjects suffering adverse events  - particular threshold levels of antibody titer level - based on a receiving a particular treatment
age_min: include both case/affected and control subjects
age_max: include both case/affected and control subjects
number_subjects: Often differs by signature within a publication. If number of subjects for a particular signature is not clear in text, use total for cohort.
tissue_type: The parent tissue of the response components.  Report multiple tissues in different rows.   For cell-type results, the tissue is often PBMCs.  For gene expression, the tissue might be a particular cell-type.
tissue_type_term_id: If there is no matching cell type in the pulldown list, the curator can try to look up a matching term in the  Cell Ontology. If there is no appropriate Cell Ontology term, UBERON codes can also be used.
method: The primary experimental method used to measure the response, e.g.  RNA-seq, CyTOF, CITE-seq.
response_component: The entities whose response is being measured.  Please copy symbols and names exactly as reported in the publication - except spell out greek letters.  For cell types, this includes all markers.  Examples for a signature with three cell types: T cells CD3+/CD4+/Ki67+; T cells CD3+/CD8+/Ki67+ CD86+ myeloid dendritic cell (DC); CD86+ monocyte
is_model: Were the response components chosen using a classification or other model-building strategy?
response_behavior_type: The type of change being measured, e.g. gene expression, cell-type frequency.
response_behavior: Common values in the pulldown list: - up, down - positively correlated, negatively correlated, correlated - positively predictive, negatively predictive, predictive
comparison: Comparisons are typically between two groups, or may reflect a  correlation of the response component with some other measured variable.   Only report significant results.   Examples: - severe COVID-19 cases vs healthy - moderate COVID-19 cases vs healthy; severe COVID-19 cases vs healthy - interferon-stimulated genes in COVID-19 vs healthy - bacterial DNA levels across COVID-19 and healthy subjects Include time comparison if relevant, e.g. 7d vs 0d, where the times are relative to the baseline reference event time (0d). Times before baseline event can be entered as negative numbers, e.g. days before vaccination (7d vs -1d). **Please be concise.**
baseline_time_event: The reference event from which the time of the experimental response  is measured, e.g. hospital admission, onset of symptoms
time_point: Time point when response was measured, if available.
exposure_material: Enter the pathogen or vaccine underlying the immune exposure as reported in the publication or use the NCBI Taxonomy term name
exposure_material_id: NCBI Taxonomy ID of pathogen causing disease. Use format id_type:id, e.g. ncbi_taxid:2697049
exposure_process: Method by which exposure to pathogen occurred
disease_stage: Reported disease stage(s) of affected subjects in all comparisons entered in row (not including control subjects).  We will not attempt to match these directly with the comparisons.
publication_reference_id: Enter an official identifier for the article curated, using format type:id
publication_date: Use zeros for unavailable month or day
publication_reference_url: URL of the article curated.  Primary source publication (e.g. Cell, Nature) preferred over PMC
signature_source: Figure, table number etc. where the signature was found, usually the original primary publication rather than PMC
signature_source_url: Link to figure, table number etc. where the signature was found, usually the original primary publication rather than PMC. Please enter the URL directly, not as a hyperlinked name.
comments: Details clarifying any aspect of the signature not captured in other fields
curator_comments: Questions or notes for further examination from curator. Will not appear in Dashboard

response_component: lymphocytes (bound to BD TruCount beads)
curator_comments: Unsure what to put for "response component." The paper reports on lymphocytes, but doesn't specify a gating strategy; just that they counted lymphocytes as cells bound to BD TruCount beads.

comparison: convalescing vs pooled mild or severe disease
curator_comments: Table 1 shows the day post symptom onset that the first sample (covid-19) and convalescing sample were collected. These timepoipnts were then compared in Figure 4. I included these dates in the baseline time event and timepoint columns (Q,R) for each of the 7 subjects, but was unsure if this was r formatted correctly as these sampling dates were not consistent across subjects. For reference (the 7 subjects can be found in Table 1: ID: 013, 027, 004, 006, 009, 017, 025)
